net.unto.twitter
Class Api

java.lang.Object
  net.unto.twitter.Api

public class Api
extends Object

Instances of the Api class provide access to the Twitter web service.

The Api class acts a factory for individual Api requests. The Api class and request methods attempt to provide sensible defaults when possible, and rely on standard builder patterns to customize each as required.

Example usage: 

 Api api = Api.DEFAULT_API;
 List<Status> statuses = api.publicTimeline().build().get();
 for (Status status : statuses) {
   System.out.println(status.getText());
 }

A more involved example: 

 Api api = Api.builder().username("username").password("password").build();
 Status status = api.updateStatus("Hello Twitter").inReplyToStatusId(12345)
     .build().post();
 System.out.println(status.getText());

DEFAULT_API

public static final Api DEFAULT_API
An Api instance configured with the default settings.

Does not support authenticated requests.

Example usage:

List<TwitterProtos.Status> publicTimeline = Api.DEFAULT_API.publicTimeline().build().get();

Method Detail

builder

public static Api.Builder builder()
Return a new mutable builder for Api instances.

Returns:
a new mutable builder for Api instances.

destroyStatus

public DestroyStatusRequest.Builder destroyStatus(long id)
Destroys the status specified by the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the author of the specified status.

Example usage:

TwitterProtos.Status status = api.destroyStatus(12345).build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID of the status to destroy.
Returns:
A DestroyStatusRequest.Builder instance.

followers

public FollowersRequest.Builder followers()
Returns the authenticating user's followers, each with current status inline. They are ordered by the order in which they joined Twitter (this is going to be changed).

Supports the id and page optional parameters.

Example usage:

List<TwitterProtos.User> followers = api.followers().build().get();

Returns:
A FollowersRequest.Builder instance supporting the id and page optional parameters.

friends

public FriendsRequest.Builder friends()
Returns the authenticating user's friends, each with current status inline. They are ordered by the order in which they were added as friends. It's also possible to request another user's recent friends list via the id parameter below.

Supports the id and page optional parameters.

Example usage:

List<TwitterProtos.User> friends = api.friends().build().get();

Returns:
A FriendsRequest.Builder instance supporting the id and page optional parameters.

friendsTimeline

public FriendsTimelineRequest.Builder friendsTimeline()
Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted by the authenticating user and that user's friends. This is the equivalent of /home on the Web.

Supports the count, page, since, and sinceId optional parameters.

Example usage:

List<TwitterProtos.Status> friendsTimeline = api.friendsTimeline().build().get();

Returns:
A FriendsTimelineRequest.Builder instance supporting the count, page, since, and sinceId optional parameters.

publicTimeline

public PublicTimelineRequest.Builder publicTimeline()
Returns the 20 most recent statuses from non-protected users who have set a custom user icon. Does not require authentication. Note that the public timeline is cached for 60 seconds so requesting it more often than that is a waste of resources.

Example usage:

List<TwitterProtos.Status> publicTimeline = api.publicTimeline().build().get();

Returns:
A PublicTimelineRequest.Builder instance supporting the page optional parameter.

replies

public RepliesRequest.Builder replies()
Returns the 20 most recent @replies (status updates prefixed with @username) for the authenticating user.

Example usage:

List<TwitterProtos.Status> replies = api.replies().build().get();

Returns:
A RepliesRequest.Builder instance supporting the page, since, and sinceId optional parameters.

showStatus

public ShowStatusRequest.Builder showStatus(long id)
Returns a single status, specified by the id parameter below. The status's author will be returned inline.

Example usage:

TwitterProtos.Status status = api.showStatus(12345).build().get();

Parameters:
id - The numerical ID of the status you're trying to retrieve.
Returns:
A ShowStatusRequest.Builder instance.

updateStatus

public UpdateStatusRequest.Builder updateStatus(String status)
Updates the authenticating user's status. Requires the status parameter specified below. Request must be a POST. A status update with text identical to the authenticating user's current status will be ignored.

Example usage:

TwitterProtos.Status status = api.updateStatus("Hello Twitter").build().post();

Parameters:
status - The text of your status update. Should not be more than 140 characters.
Returns:
A UpdateStatusRequest.Builder instance supporting the inReplyToStatusId optional parameter.

userTimeline

public UserTimelineRequest.Builder userTimeline()
Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted from the authenticating user. It's also possible to request another user's timeline via the id parameter below. This is the equivalent of the Web /archive page for your own user, or the profile page for a third party.

Example usage:

List<TwitterProtos.Status> userTimeline = api.userTimeline().build().get();

Returns:
A UserTimelineRequest.Builder instance supporting the id, count, page, since, and sinceId optional parameters.

showUser

public ShowUserRequest.Builder showUser()
Returns extended information of a given user, specified by ID or screen name as per the required id parameter below. This information includes design settings, so third party developers can theme their widgets according to a given user's preferences. You must be properly authenticated to request the page of a protected user.

Example usage:

TwitterProtos.User user = api.showUser().id("dewitt").build().get();

Returns:
A ShowUserRequest.Builder instance supporting the id, screenName, and userId parameters, exactly one of which must be specified.

directMessages

public DirectMessagesRequest.Builder directMessages()
Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user.

Example usage:

List directMessages = api.directMessages().build().get();

Returns:
A DirectMessagesRequest.Builder instance.

sentDirectMessages

public SentDirectMessagesRequest.Builder sentDirectMessages()
Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent by the authenticating user.

Example usage:

List directMessages = api.sentDirectMessages().build().get();

Returns:
A SentDirectMessagesRequest.Builder instance supporting the page, since, and sinceId optional parameters.

newDirectMessage

public NewDirectMessageRequest.Builder newDirectMessage(String user,
                                                        String status)
Sends a new direct message to the specified user from the authenticating user.

Example usage:

TwitterProtos.DirectMessage directMessage = api.newDirectMessage("dewitt", "Hello DeWitt").build().post();

Parameters:
user - The ID or screen name of the recipient user.
status - The text of your status update. Should not be more than 140 characters.
Returns:
A NewDirectMessageRequest.Builder instance.

destroyDirectMessage

public DestroyDirectMessageRequest.Builder destroyDirectMessage(long id)
Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the recipient of the specified direct message.

Example usage:

DirectMessage directMessage = api.destroyDirectMessage(12345).build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID of the direct message to destroy.
Returns:
A DestroyDirectMessageRequest.Builder instance.

Befriends the user specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user.

Example usage:

User user = api.createFriendship("dewitt").build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID or screen name of the user to befriend
Returns:
A CreateFriendshipRequest.Builder instance supporting the follow optional parameter.

Discontinues friendship with the user specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user

Example usage:

User user = api.destroyFriendship("dewitt").build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID or screen name of the user with whom to discontinue friendship.
Returns:
A DestroyFriendshipRequest.Builder instance.

friendshipExists

public FriendshipExistsRequest.Builder friendshipExists(String userA,
                                                        String userB)
Tests if a friendship exists between two users.

Example usage:

boolean friendshipExists = api.friendshipExists("ev", "biz).build().post();

Parameters:
userA - The ID or screen_name of the first user to test friendship for.
userB - The ID or screen_name of the second user to test friendship for.
Returns:
A FriendshipExistsRequest.Builder instance.

public FriendIdsRequest.Builder friendIds()
Returns an array of numeric IDs for every user the specified user is following.

Example usage:

long[] following = api.friendIds().build().get();

Returns:
A FriendIdsRequest.Builder instance supporting the id optional parameter.

followerIds

public FollowerIdsRequest.Builder followerIds()
Returns an array of numeric IDs for every user the specified user is followed by.

Example usage:

long[] followers = api.followerIds().build().get();

Returns:
A FollowerIdsRequest.Builder instance supporting the id optional parameter.

verifyCredentials

public VerifyCredentialsRequest.Builder verifyCredentials()
Returns a representation of the requesting user if authentication was successful.

Returns:
A VerifyCredentialsRequest.Builder instance.

endSession

public EndSessionRequest.Builder endSession()
Ends the session of the authenticating user.

Returns:
A EndSessionRequest.Builder instance.

updateDeliveryDevice

public UpdateDeliveryDeviceRequest.Builder updateDeliveryDevice(TwitterProtos.Device device)
Sets which device Twitter delivers updates to for the authenticating user. Sending none as the device parameter will disable IM or SMS updates.

Example usage:

User user = api.updateDeliveryDevice(Device.SMS).build().post();

Parameters:
device - Must be one of: sms, im, none.
Returns:
A UpdateDeliveryDeviceRequest.Builder instance.

trends

public TrendsRequest.Builder trends()
Returns the top ten queries that are currently trending on Twitter. The response includes the time of the request, the name of each trending topic, and the url to the Twitter Search results page for that topic.

Example usage: 

 Trends trends = api.trends().build().get();
 for (Trend trend : trends.getTrends()) {
   System.out.println(trend.getName());
 }

Returns:
A TrendsRequest.Builder instance.

search

public SearchRequest.Builder search(String query)
Returns tweets that match a specified query. You can use a variety of search operators in your query.

Example usage: 

 Results results = api.search("@dewitt").build().get();
 for (Result result : results.getResults()) {
   System.out.println(result.getText());
 }

Returns:
A SearchRequest.Builder instance supporting the geocode, lang, page, resultsPerPage, showUser, and sinceId optional parameters.

updateProfileColors

public UpdateProfileColorsRequest.Builder updateProfileColors()
Sets one or more hex values that control the color scheme of the authenticating user's profile page on twitter.com.

Example usage: 

 User user = api.updateProfileColors().profileBackgroundColor("FFFFFF").build()
     .post();

Returns:
A UpdateProfileColorsRequest.Builder instance supporting the profileBackgroundColor, profileLinkColor, profileSidebarBorderColor, profileSidebarFillColor, and profileTextColor optional parameters.

updateProfileImage

public UpdateProfileImageRequest.Builder updateProfileImage(File file)
Updates the authenticating user's profile image. Expects raw multipart data, not a URL to an image.

Example usage: 

 File file = new File("profile_image.png");
 User user = api.updateProfileImage(file).build().post();

Returns:
A UpdateProfileImageRequest.Builder instance.

updateProfileBackgroundImage

public UpdateProfileBackgroundImageRequest.Builder updateProfileBackgroundImage(File file)
Updates the authenticating user's profile background image. Expects raw multipart data, not a URL to an image.

Example usage: 

 File file = new File("profile_background_image.png");
 User user = api.updateProfileBackgroundImage(file).build().post();

Returns:
A UpdateProfileBackgroundImageRequest.Builder instance.

rateLimitStatus

public RateLimitStatusRequest.Builder rateLimitStatus()
Returns the remaining number of API requests available to the requesting user before the API limit is reached for the current hour. Calls to rate_limit_status do not count against the rate limit. If authentication credentials are provided, the rate limit status for the authenticating user is returned. Otherwise, the rate limit status for the requester's IP address is returned.

Example usage: 

 RateLimitStatus rateLimitStatus = api.rateLimitStatus().build().get();
 System.out.println(rateLimitStatus.getRemainingHits());

Returns:
A RateLimitStatusRequest.Builder instance.

updateProfile

public UpdateProfileRequest.Builder updateProfile()
Sets values that users are able to set under the "Account" tab of their settings page. Only the parameters specified will be updated; to only update the "name" attribute, for example, only include that parameter in your request.

Example usage: 

 User user = api.updateProfile().name("DeWitt Clinton").build().post();

Returns:
A UpdateProfileRequest.Builder instance supporting the description, email, location, name, and url optional parameters.

favorites

public FavoritesRequest.Builder favorites()
Returns the 20 most recent favorite statuses for the authenticating user or user specified by the ID parameter in the requested format.

Supports the id and page optional parameters.

Example usage:

List favorites = api.favorites().build().get();

Returns:
A FavoritesRequest.Builder instance supporting the id and page optional parameters.

createFavorite

public CreateFavoriteRequest.Builder createFavorite(long id)
Favorites the status specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the favorite status when successful.

Example usage:

Status favorite = api.createFavorite(12345).build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID of the status to favorite.
Returns:
A CreateFavoriteRequest.Builder instance.

destroyFavorite

public DestroyFavoriteRequest.Builder destroyFavorite(long id)
Un-favorites the status specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the un-favorited status in the requested format when successful.

Example usage:

Status favorite = api.destroyFavorite(12345).build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID of the status to un-favorite
Returns:
A DestroyFavoriteRequest.Builder instance.

follow

public FollowRequest.Builder follow(String id)
Enables notifications for updates from the specified user to the authenticating user. Returns the specified user when successful.

Example usage:

User following = api.follow("dewitt").build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID or screen name of the user to follow.
Returns:
A FollowRequest.Builder instance.

leave

public LeaveRequest.Builder leave(String id)
Disables notifications for updates from the specified user to the authenticating user. Returns the specified user when successful.

Example usage:

User notFollowing = api.leave("dewitt").build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID or screen name of the user to leave.
Returns:
A LeaveRequest.Builder instance.

createBlock

public CreateBlockRequest.Builder createBlock(String id)
Blocks the user specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the blocked user in the requested format when successful.

Example usage:

User blocked = api.createBlock("dewitt").build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID or screen_name of the user to block.
Returns:
A CreateBlockRequest.Builder instance.

destroyBlock

public DestroyBlockRequest.Builder destroyBlock(String id)
Un-blocks the user specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the un-blocked user in the requested format when successful.

Example usage:

User unblocked = api.destroyBlock("dewitt").build().post();

Parameters:
id - The ID or screen_name of the user to un-block.
Returns:
A DestroyBlockRequest.Builder instance.

test

public TestRequest.Builder test()
Returns the string "ok" in the requested format with a 200 OK HTTP status code.

Example usage:

String ok = api.test().build().get();

Returns:
A TestRequest.Builder instance.
